data.title: New Communities in Centerville, IN
data.meta_description: Search for New Home Communities in Centerville near Dayton & Springfield, Ohio with NewHomeSource, the expert in Centerville new home communities and Centerville home builders.
data.text:
For a city whose motto is “Progress, Stability”, Centerville sure does live up to its rallying cry. This can be seen particularly in its real estate industry which is graced by very competent builders whose propensity for creative designs seems to be endless. Home for sale in Centerville, Ohio are stable and reliable. Montgomery and Greene counties are proud to host this beautiful city. So let’s find out what makes Centerville so special.

If you are looking for a new home or move in ready home, you will not look for long. More than 10 builders in the area have set up, or are in the process of constructing new home communities. The beauty is that there is something for everyone. These award winning builders made sure to appeal to residents and potential home buyers with different tastes. Home themes range from Vintage, Classic and Victorian to Modern and contemporary – with prices starting from the mid-200s up to the mid-500s. New Home Source has so much information about the builders, location, types, and price of these rare finds.

The city’s economy is supported by Dayton Metropolitan Area which is the fourth largest Metropolitan Area in the State of Ohio. The last few decades has seen various industries such as the health, education, and manufacturing industries grow at an impressively fast rate. Owing to these changes, many residents have secured good jobs among the state’s leading corporations. Premier Health Partners, University of Dayton, and AK Steel Holding are all headquartered in Centerville.

Schools in the city are run by the Centerville City School District. Thousands of students get quality education in the public and private schools falling under this district. The schools include Centerville High School and Seventh Day Adventist Pre-12 Preparatory School. Scholars alike are fortunate enough to have access to Washington/Centerville Public Library. This nationally ranked library has just about 400,000 study materials in the form of books, movies, videos, educational programs, research assistance, and music.

It is believed by many that the quickest way to get to know a city is by sampling its cuisine. Perhaps it’s because food is a major component of life. Sweeney’s Seafood is the go to place for seafood fine dining. The Oyster Rockefeller appetizer will definitely get your palate going. For outdoor experiences, kids will fall in love with the Laser We and Poelking Bowling Centers – so why not treat them to some weekend afternoon family fun?

Narrow Your New Home Search:

Finding just the right home can be a challenge. Try filtering your results to browse different types of home types across Dayton & Springfield or brand new subdivisions.
